In certain embodiments "specifically binds" means, for instance, that an antibody binds a protein with a KD of about 0.1 nM or less, but more usually less than about 1µM.
In certain embodiments, "specifically binds" means that an antibody binds a target at times with a KD of at least about 0.1 µM or less, at other times at least about 0.01µM or less, and at other times at least about 1 nM or less.

The EC50 of the binding of biotinylated cH2B4 to Jurkat cells was determined to be 0.8nM.
Table 10 shows the result of IC50 values of competition binding when mutations were introduced in CD3 antibody H2B4 to optimize the frameworks, with h2B4 1.0/1.0T (2B5) having an IC50 of 1.27, however unit is missing for this value.
